question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [Provider trust] Does the target_metrics_provider properly authenticate and validate the metrics source, or can a MITM attacker inject fake metrics during the scrape? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [Provider substitution] Can the ProviderCollection be manipulated to substitute a malicious MetricsProvider that always returns passing metrics regardless of actual node health? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Macro: get_provider!] [Type confusion] Can the get_provider! macro at line 99-103 be exploited with type confusion to return a provider of the wrong type that bypasses validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [Scrape validation] Does the Scrape object from prometheus_parse properly validate Prometheus exposition format, or can malformed scrapes cause parser exploits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [Metrics endpoint] If the target node's metrics endpoint is compromised or redirected, can attackers serve fake metrics that always show healthy consensus behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: build_check_result()] [Boundary condition] When latest_timeouts_count exactly equals previous_timeouts_count + allowed_consensus_timeouts, does the '>' comparison at line 69 correctly allow this as valid, or should it be '>='? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: build_check_result()] [False negatives] If allowed_consensus_timeouts is set very high (e.g., millions), can severely degraded consensus nodes pass checks despite experiencing critical failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: build_check_result()] [Comparison semantics] Does the comparison logic properly handle the case where timeouts decrease (counter reset), or does it silently pass such anomalies as valid? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: build_check_result()] [Score calculation] The passing score is hardcoded to 100 (line 82) and failing to 50 (line 73) - can this scoring system be gamed by nodes that repeatedly fail and pass to maintain average scores? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [Check frequency] Does the checker run frequently enough to detect rapid timeout spikes, or can attackers cause brief consensus disruptions between checks that go undetected? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [Metrics scraping cost] Can malicious nodes provide extremely large Prometheus scrapes (many metrics/labels) causing excessive parsing time and DoS of the checker service? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [Sleep blocking] Does tokio::time::sleep() at line 119 block other checkers, or can long check_delay values cause cascading delays affecting other node health validations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [Provider timeout] If the metrics provider hangs or has very long timeouts, can this block the checker indefinitely preventing validation of other nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [Memory exhaustion] Can repeated checker invocations with failing scrapes accumulate error messages (format! allocations) causing memory exhaustion over time? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: get_consensus_timeouts()] [String allocation] Do the format! calls at lines 54-56 and throughout the file allocate unbounded strings that could exhaust memory with malicious input? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Struct: ConsensusTimeoutsChecker] [State isolation] Is the ConsensusTimeoutsChecker struct stateless, or can previous check() invocations affect future results through hidden mutable state? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [Context loss] When check() returns early due to scrape failures, does the caller properly distinguish between 'node failing checks' vs 'unable to check node'? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [Result aggregation] Does the Vec<CheckResult> properly support multiple failure reasons, or can important context be lost when multiple issues occur simultaneously? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: build_result()] [Message consistency] Can the evaluation_summary and message strings be manipulated to inject misleading information into check results that affect validator selection? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [Async state] Does the async check() function properly handle concurrent invocations, or can parallel checks on the same node produce inconsistent results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [Metrics authenticity] Does the checker verify cryptographic signatures on metrics data to ensure they come from the claimed node, preventing impersonation attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [TLS validation] If metrics are scraped over HTTPS, does the checker properly validate TLS certificates to prevent MITM attacks on metrics data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Constant: METRIC] [Metric name integrity] Can the metric name string be modified at runtime through unsafe code or memory corruption to query different metrics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/consensus_timeouts.rs] [Function: check()] [Data integrity] Are Prometheus scrape results integrity-protected against tampering during transmission and storage? (Medium)
